intro: Eleutheroglossum jocosum, commonly known as the laughing orchid, is a rare and unusual orchid species native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a distinctive, elongated labellum that resembles a smile, contributing to its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer, and it thrives in cool, humid environments with well-drained soil. Eleutheroglossum jocosum is a terrestrial orchid with a short, creeping rhizome and is typically found in dense forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
